explanation: To decide whether create_response_object violates the MISRA rule against direct or indirect self-calls we must examine the implementations (or their transitive call graphs) of every function it may call. • MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static — one branch of create_response_object calls this; its body/callees must be checked for any path back to create_response_object. • MHD_create_response_from_buffer — the alternative (pre-0x00097701) branch calls this variant; its body/callees must also be checked. • MHD_create_response_empty — the function is called in one branch; although the provided graph shows it has no callees, its implementation must be inspected to confirm it does not (transitively) call create_response_object. • MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls — the static variant is known (from the call graph) to call this function; therefore this callee and its transitive callees must be analyzed for any path back to create_response_object. Inspecting these symbols (and their transitive callees) is sufficient to determine whether any call chain starting from create_response_object can lead back to create_response_object (i.e., direct or indirect recursion).
